#Text=Death toll from Borneo bridge collapse reaches eleven
#Text=Monday , November 28 , 2011
#Text=The death toll from the weekend suspension bridge collapse on the Indonesian island of Borneo has risen from four to eleven .
#Text=Search and rescue teams continue to look for bodies in the Mahakam River .

#Text=The number of wounded is currently 39 injured ; reports from locals suggest 33 people remain missing at the scene in East Kalimantan 's Kutai Kartanegara district , where " Kalimantan 's Golden Gate Bridge " linked the towns of Tenggarong and the regional capital , Samarinda .
#Text=A six-month-old baby is among the dead .
#Text=Kutai Kartanegara Bridge .
#Text=Image : Ezagren .
#Text=Cars , motorbikes , and buses all fell into the Mahakam River when the bridge came down during repairs .
#Text=Another car was left overturned and balanced upon wreckage over the water .
#Text=State-owned builders PT Hutama Karya completed the bridge about a decade ago in the image of California 's Golden Gate Bridge .
#Text=A cable on the 720-metre structure is thought to have failed as workers dealt with it ; six of the repair crew were reported missing yesterday .
#Text=It had been the longest suspension bridge in Borneo .
#Text=Eyewitnesses described heavy traffic at the time of the collapse , and one survivor said he left his truck to investigate a traffic jam .
#Text=Some people were left trapped by debris as the bridge came down .
#Text=" It happened so fast , only about 30 seconds , " according to National Disaster Management Agency spokesman Sutopo Nugoroho .

#Text=National search and rescue head Daryatmo said yesterday cranes will attempt to move debris today , with new reports saying echo-sounding equipment will be used to check it is safe to begin lifting .
#Text=It is believed the bodies of more victims will be found trapped in vehicles beneath the water , which is 35-40 metres deep .
#Text=Visibility is poor , and one official explained authorities are still unsure how many vehicles are on the riverbed .
#Text=The famous Golden Gate Bridge in the USA , which the bridge in Borneo aimed to replicate .
#Text=Image : Rich Niewiroski Jr. .

#Text=" The above-water search is continuing , but underwater operations have not been carried out because we 're worried that the bridge 's pylons are unstable and could collapse any time , " said Nugoroho today .
#Text=He explained that bodies had washed onto the riverbanks overnight and were recovered today .

#Text=The president , Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono , has sent three ministers to the site to investigate the accident , while Bambang Widaryatmo , head of East Kalimantan 's police , promised " parties found to be negligent will be prosecuted " .
#Text=The government has promised a replacement ferry service .

#Text=The river is closed to boats as rescue operations continue , and a 22-strong team has been dispatched from the national police , comprising six forensics experts , five disaster victim identification specialists , and eleven investigators .
#Text=They are there to augment the East Kalimantan Police .
#Text=Health Minister Endang Rahayu Sedyaningsih yesterday visited survivors in Parikesit Hospital and promised them medical treatment at government expense .
#Text=Some people swam ashore after falling , with the aftermath filled with screams .
#Text=Survivor Syakrani , 24 , yesterday asserted " The authorities should have closed the bridge if it was under repair .

#Text=The Globe went on to comment upon suggestions corruption may have played a role ;  It is too early to point fingers and look to place blame , but if shoddy materials were used in the building of the bridge , those responsible must answer to the public .
